Package mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls

Class AbstractEcall

  • java.lang.Object
    • mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls.AbstractEcall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Ecall
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EcallClose, EcallExit, EcallExit2, EcallOpen, EcallPrintChar, EcallPrintDouble, EcallPrintFloat, EcallPrintIntHex, EcallPrintIntUnsigned, EcallPrintNumber, EcallPrintNumberBinary, EcallPrintString, EcallRandDouble, EcallRandFloat, EcallRandInt, EcallRandIntRange, EcallRandSeed, EcallRead, EcallReadChar, EcallReadDouble, EcallReadFloat, EcallReadInt, EcallReadString, EcallSbrk, EcallSleep, EcallTime, EcallWrite

    public abstract class AbstractEcall
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ecall
    Abstract class that a RISCV ecall system service may extend. A qualifying service must be a class in the mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls package that implements the Ecall interface, must be compiled into a .class file, and its .class file must be in the same folder as Ecall.class. Mars will detect a qualifying ecall upon startup, create an instance using its no-argument constructor and add it to its ecall list. When its service is invoked at runtime ("ecall" instruction with its service number stored in register a3), its simulate() method will be invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName​()
        Return the name you have chosen for this ecall. This can be used by a MARS user to refer to the service when choosing to override its default service number in the configuration file.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Ecall
        Returns:
        service name as a string

      • setNumber

        public void setNumber​(int num)
        Set the service number. This is provided to allow MARS implementer or user to override the default service number.
        Specified by:
        setNumber in interface Ecall
        Parameters:
        num - specified service number to override the default.

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber​()
        Return the assigned service number. This is the number the RISCV programmer must store into a3 before issuing the ECALL instruction.
        Specified by:
        getNumber in interface Ecall
        Returns:
        assigned service number

      • simulate

        public abstract void simulate​(ProgramStatement statement)
                       throws ProcessingException
        Performs ecall function. It will be invoked when the service is invoked at simulation time. Service is identified by value stored in a3.
        Specified by:
        simulate in interface Ecall
        Parameters:
        statement - ProgramStatement object for this ecall instruction.
        Throws:
        ProcessingException
